TelemetryHeaderModel.title: TelemetryHeaderModel
TelemetryHeaderModel.description: A base model for Telemetry Data

HWState.title: HWState
HWState.description: HWState defines the possible states of a HW device

ct_number.title: Ct Number
ct_number.description: CT Number of the base board - HP-specific identifier (PRIMARY KEY)

ct_number.title: Ct Number
ct_number.description: Battery CT Number - HP-specific format (PRIMARY KEY)

BatteryUsage.title: BatteryUsage
BatteryUsage.description:
Battery Events captured on a frequency defined by the Battery Usage trigger
This may mean weekly, daily, or listening to certain events

Most fields are available in upower

cycle_count.title: Cycle Count
cycle_count.description: Number of full discharge cycles of the battery

energy_full.title: Energy Full
energy_full.description:
Total Energy when the battery is at its full capacity (in Wh) 
    This value is the main indicator of the expected life of a battery

energy_remaining.title: Energy Remaining
energy_remaining.description: Remaining energy (in Wh) of the battery before reaching zero in this discharge cycle

energy_rate.title: Energy Rate
energy_rate.description: Charge or Discharge energy rate (in W)

status_register.title: Status Register
status_register.description: Status Register - Bit encoded battery status

cell_voltage.title: Cell Voltage
cell_voltage.description: Cell Voltages (ordered list of voltages, mV) - Most devices have 3 cells, but 4 and 2 are also found.

bus_info.title: Bus Info
bus_info.description:
Graphic Card Bus Info
        ID of the device connected to the bus. This field forms a compound key with serial_number

memory_size.title: Memory Size
memory_size.description: Memory Size (in MBs) - Available memory in the graphic card.

serial_number.title: Serial Number
serial_number.description: Serial Number of the Chip (PRIMARY KEY)

part_number.title: Part Number
part_number.description: Part Number of the Chip (PRIMARY KEY)

locator.title: Locator
locator.description: Locator - Label of the socket or circuit board that holds the memory

rank.title: Rank
rank.description: Rank - Number of DIMM ranks in the memory array.

manufacturer.title: Manufacturer
manufacturer.description: Manufacturer of the Network card / interface

PeripheralUSBTypeA.title: PeripheralUSBTypeA
PeripheralUSBTypeA.description:
PeripheralUSBTypeA is any gadget that is plugged/unplugged from one of the USB type A ports
Including: External Mic, External Camera, USB Flash Drive, etc.

Linux source will be a combination of dmesg, /proc/kmesg, journalctl, udev, lsusb

Primary keys are the DEVICE ID and the BUS ID telling where it was added/removed

message.title: Message
message.description: Any extra Warning or Critical messages shown in the log
examples:
[multi-line class extracted from dmesg -Hw after adding a headset: Jabra UC VOICE 750a MS]
        usb 3-2: Warning! Unlikely big volume range (=4096), cval->res is probably wrong.
        usb 3-2: [11] FU [Sidetone Playback Volume] ch: 1, val: 0/4096/1

PeripheralUSBTypeC.title: PeripheralUSBTypeC
PeripheralUSBTypeC.description: Peripheral USB Type-C used in SuperSpeed mode - TODO

PeripheralUSBTypeCDisplayPort.title: PeripheralUSBTypeCDisplayPort
PeripheralUSBTypeCDisplayPort.description: Peripheral USB Type-C used in DisplayPort mode - TODO

device_id.title: Device Id
device_id.description: Device Id (PRIMARY KEY) - The DeviceID property contains a str uniquely identifying the processor with other devices on the system.

processor_id.title: Processor Id
processor_id.description: Processor Id (PRIMARY KEY) - Processor information that describes the processor features.

name.title: Name
examples: AMD Ryzen 7 PRO 5850U with Radeon Graphics

cores_count.title: Cores Count
cores_count.description: CPU Cores Count - Number of cores for the current instance of the processor.

cores_enabled.title: Cores Enabled
cores_enabled.description: CPU Cores Enabled - The number of enabled cores per processor socket.

capabilities.title: Capabilities
examples: x86-64 fpu fpu_exception wp vme de pse tsc msr pae mce cx8

serial_number.title: Serial Number
serial_number.description: Drive Serial Number (PRIMARY KEY) - Serialnumber for the NVM subsystem that is assigned by the vendor

model.title: Model
model.description: Drive Model - Model of the NVM subsystem that is assigned by the vendor.

NVMEStorageLogical.title: NVMEStorageLogical
NVMEStorageLogical.description: A wrapper model of all events

serial_number.title: Serial Number
serial_number.description: Drive Serial Number (PRIMARY KEY) - Serialnumber for the NVM subsystem that is assigned by the vendor

used_capacity.title: Used Capacity
used_capacity.description: Used Drive Capacity (in GBs, rounded up to the nearest Giga)

NVMESmartLog.title: NVMESmartLog
NVMESmartLog.description:
NVME SMART Log

Example of Smart Log
> nvme smart-log /dev/nvme0n1
    Smart Log for NVME device:nvme0n1 namespace-id:ffffffff
    critical_warning                                        : 0
    temperature                                                 : 43 C
    available_spare                                         : 100%
    available_spare_threshold                           : 5%
    percentage_used                                         : 0%
    endurance group critical warning summary    : 0
    data_units_read                                         : 1,272,801
    data_units_written                                      : 1,487,259
    host_read_commands                                      : 8,453,724
    host_write_commands                                     : 8,829,396
    controller_busy_time                                : 41
    power_cycles                                            : 203
    power_on_hours                                          : 39
    unsafe_shutdowns                                        : 87
    media_errors                                            : 0
    num_err_log_entries                                     : 280
    Warning Temperature Time                            : 0
    Critical Composite Temperature Time             : 0
    Temperature Sensor 1                        : 43 C
    Temperature Sensor 2                        : 40 C
    Thermal Management T1 Trans Count               : 0
    Thermal Management T2 Trans Count               : 0
    Thermal Management T1 Total Time                : 0
    Thermal Management T2 Total Time                : 0

serial_number.title: Serial Number
serial_number.description: Drive Serial Number (PRIMARY KEY) - Serialnumber for the NVM subsystem that is assigned by the vendor

serialnumber.title: Serialnumber
serialnumber.description:
System Serial Number (PRIMARY KEY)
        Contains encoded information that represents serial number of system or device.
        Format: 
        * CCC = supplier code (encoded)
        * YMM = week of manufacture (encoded)
        * RRRR = random values

uuid.title: Uuid
uuid.description: System UUID (PRIMARY KEY) - Universally Unique Identifier is a 16-octet (128-bit) number

source.Linux: /sys/class/dmi/id/chassis_type (converted from number to str if desired)

feature_byte.title: Feature Byte
feature_byte.description: Feature byte contains a series of flags that indicates whether a software or hardware component is pre-installed.
examples: 3K3Q6b7K7M7WaBaNapaqasawbhbzcbdUdXdpdq.mD ( The 'cb' in the middle means '30 days McAfee trial')

ThermalContextSample.title: ThermalContextSample
ThermalContextSample.description:
Samples of the sensors that have any correlation/causation effect in temperature and cooling.

These sensors are:
* Temperature readings from the sensors spread on the components of the PC (Processor, GPU, Battery, Storage, Wifi card, etc.) as well as the base board
* Cooling device velocity sensor (when possible, collect requested vs. actual velocity)
* Power sensor (which could be System power or Compoenent power)

sensor_index.title: Sensor Index
sensor_index.description: Sensor Index (only used when the same name has more than one value)

ThermalContext.title: ThermalContext
ThermalContext.description:
Thermal Context it is the context of all sensor readings that correlate/cause thermal variations

When collected all Thermal Samples should be read

start_trigger_event.title: Start Trigger Event
start_trigger_event.description: Trigger Event - Event that triggers the sample collection.

manufacturer_version.title: Manufacturer Version
manufacturer_version.description:
TPM Manufacturer Version
            The version of the TPM, as specified by the manufacturer.
            When the data is unavailable, "Not Supported" is returned.

source.Linux:
if WMI - Win32_TPM.ManufacturerVersionFull20 has a value (which is not null or empty and does not say "Not Supported")
            WMI - Win32_TPM - ManufacturerVersionFull20
        else 
            WMI - Win32_TPM - ManufacturerVersion

manufacturer_version_info.title: Manufacturer Version Info
manufacturer_version_info.description:
Manufacturer Version Information 
        Other manufacturer-specific version information for the TPM.
        When the data is unavailable, "Not Supported" is returned.

trusted_computing_group_version.title: Trusted Computing Group Version
trusted_computing_group_version.description:
TCG Specification Version 
        The version of the Trusted Computing Group (TCG) specification that the TPM supports. This value includes the major and minor TCG specification version, the specification revision level, and the errata revision level. All values are in hexadecimal. For example, a version information of "1.2, 2, 0" indicates that the device was implemented to TCG specification version 1.2, revision level 2, and with no errata.

        When the data is unavailable, "Not Supported" is returned.

physical_presence_version.title: Physical Presence Version
physical_presence_version.description:
Physical Presence Interface Version
        A communication mechanism used to run device operations that require physical presence, that the computer supports.

tpm_activated.title: Tpm Activated
tpm_activated.description: TPM Activation - Indicates if TPM is activated or deactivated

tpm_enabled.title: Tpm Enabled
tpm_enabled.description: TPM Enablement - Indicates if TPM is enabled or disabled

tpm_has_owner.title: Tpm Has Owner
tpm_has_owner.description: TPM Has Owner - Indicates whether the TPM (i.e. device) has an owner.

SWState.title: SWState
SWState.description:
SWState defines the possible states of a SW (i.e. Application, Firmware, OS)

* INSTALLED - SW component was installed / first detected (populate all data fields)
* UNINSTALLED - SW component was uninstalled / not detected anymore (populate PKs only)
* UPDATED - SW component was updated / upgraded (populate PKs and changed fields)

Driver.title: Driver
Driver.description: Example of DRIVER data from Linux (with extra headers): > lsmod | sort Module Name Size Used By =============== ======== ========================================== aesni_intel 372736 2 ahci 40960 1 ashmen_linux 20480 0 bluetooth 544768 33 btrtl,btintel,btbcm,bnep,btusb,rfcom

kernel.title: Kernel
kernel.description: Kernel running at the time of the crash

dump_file.title: Dump File
dump_file.description: Dump File - name of the dumped memory core

up_time.title: Up Time
up_time.description: OS Up Time at the time of the crash (seconds)

load_average.title: Load Average
load_average.description: Average Load at the time of the crash

tasks_count.title: Tasks Count
tasks_count.description: Count of Tasks in the memory at the time of the crash

panic.title: Panic
panic.description: Panic - Specifies what kind of crash occurred on the machine

pid.title: Pid
pid.description: Process Id that caused the crash

command.title: Command
command.description: Name of the process that caused the crash

task.title: Task
task.description: Task - Address in memory for the offending process

cpu_cores_count.title: Cpu Cores Count
cpu_cores_count.description: CPU Cores Count - Number of the CPU where the offending process was running at the time of the crash.

process_state.title: Process State
process_state.description: State - Process State at the time of the crash
